metadata.name: This is the way
metadata.description:
I created this mixedmedia artwork on paper with acrylics, oil, inks and collage in the beginning of 2021. It has a size of 27x37cm and currently lives an analog life in Vienna, Austria. 

From December 2021 to January 2022 the artwork was chosen to digitally travel into a Virtual Reality Exhibition curated by Sergio Gomez. He wrote in the exhibition blurb: "The exhibition explores our perception of size and scale when viewing a work of art by manipulating the environment in which it is presented for viewing. **Does our appreciation and understanding of a work of art change based on how big or small we perceive it to be?**"

In April, 2022, this artwork travelled web3 and I minted it as an NFT. I wonder now: "**Does our appreciation and understanding of a work of art change based on where and in which format it exists?**"

Kindly send me a DM if you are the first owner of the NFT. I will gladly send the analog original artwork to you free of charge.
